intro: Chaetogastra canescens, commonly known as the hairy chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, and its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivores.
